text:
Colmar is a commune in Alsace in north-eastern France, in the Haut-Rhin department, of which it is a prefecture. It is in the Grand Est region.
Geography.
Colmar is in the north of the Haut-Rhin department. It is in the plain of Alsace, to the east of the Vosgues mountains. The Lauch river, a tributary of the Ill river, flows through the "commune".
It has an area of. Its average altitude is; at the city hall, the altitude is.
Climate.
The area around Colmar, at an altitude of about, is characterized by climates with few extremes of temperature. The Köppen climate classification type for the climate at Colmar is a "Marine West Coast Climate" and of the subtype "Cfb".
The average amount of precipitation for the year in Colmar is. The month with the most precipitation on average is June with of precipitation. The month with the least precipitation on average is February with an average of.
The average temperature for the year in Colmar is. The warmest month, on average, is July with an average temperature of. The coolest month on average is January, with an average temperature of.
Population.
The inhabitants of Colmar are known, in French, as "Colmariens" (women: "Colmariennes").
With a population of 68,784, Colmar has a population density of inhabitants/km2.
Evolution of the population in Colmar
Colmar forms, together with 6 other "communes", the urban area of Colmar with a population of 93,858 inhabitants (2014) and an area of. This urban area is the centre of the metropolitan area of Colmar, formed by 39 "communes" with a population of 129,678 inhabitants and an area of.
Administration.
It is part of the intercommunality "Colmar Agglomération".
